tool.name: Weeder
tool.description: Motif discovery in sequences from coregulated genes of a single species

param.name: species_code
param.label: Species to use for background comparison

param.name: analysis_type
param.label: Size of motifs and degree of degeneracy to search for

param.name: repeat_motif
param.label: Allow multiple motif occurances in each sequence

param.name: assume_all
param.label: Assume that motifs appear in all sequences of the set

param.name: n_motifs
param.label: Number of discovered motifs to report

param.name: weeder_to_meme
param.label: Also output weeder motifs in MEME format

data.name: output_all_meme
data.label: Weeder on ${on_string} ('all' motifs in MEME format)

data.name: output_best_meme
data.label: Weeder on ${on_string} ('best' motifs in MEME format)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Weeder is a program for finding novel motifs (transcription factor binding sites) conserved in a set of regulatory regions of related genes.
In addition this tool extracts 'all' matrices and 'best' matrices from the Weeder output.
-------------
.. class:: infomark
**Credits**
This Galaxy tool has been developed by Peter Briggs and Ian Donaldson within the Bioinformatics Core Facility at the University of Manchester, and runs the Weeder motif discovery package:
* Giulio Pavesi, Paolo Mereghetti, Giancarlo Mauri and Graziano Pesole, Weeder Web: discovery of transcription factor binding sites in a set of sequences from co-regulated genes, Nucl. Acids Res. (2004) 32 (suppl 2): W199-W203. * doi: 10.1093/nar/gkh465 http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/content/32/suppl_2/W199.full PMID: 15215380
This tool is compatible with Weeder 1.4.2:
* http://159.149.160.51/modtools/downloads/weeder.html
In addition it uses utility scripts developed by Ian Donaldson and Tim Burgis at the University of Manchester, to extract and motif matrices.
Please kindly acknowledge both this Galaxy tool, the Weeder package and the utility scripts if you use it in your work.
